oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Rural Schools; Schools; Educational facilities
Education - Tennessee; Education - History - Tennessee; School buildings - Tennessee
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Front view of a two-story clapboard schoolhouse with one door partially opened and six windows on left side of the building.

During this time frame the Rosenwald Fund was established and money to build African American schools in the counties became available. This is probably the first school in Carroll County which utilized funds for this purpose.
